explanation: Not enough evidence to conclude a MISRA 8.13 violation. Rule 8.13 requires a pointer to be const-qualified when it is possible to do so. In this function the parameter daemon is read-only within MHD_get_fdset2, but it is also passed to macros and other routines (MHD_DLOG, internal_get_fdset2, MHD_D_IS_USING_... macros). Those callees/macros likely accept a non-const pointer or could modify the daemon object (or rely on a non-const type), so changing the parameter to const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon might be infeasible without changing those APIs. Because “whenever possible” depends on the wider call chain and type signatures, and we cannot verify that all uses accept a const-qualified pointer, the claim cannot be confirmed. If, in the full codebase, all callees accept a const pointer and no modification occurs, then the function should be changed and the report would be correct — but based on the provided snippet and typical use (non-const logging and internal API), the report is not provably correct.
